019a4c21debdce26.voiceContent: If there's still time to burn, I'll grab a few drinks at the city tavern, but I usually don't have that much free time

0644daa10078009a.voiceContent: There's no getting around these things if you wanna survive out there

0683a115abf63f6a.voiceContent: So, they hired a group of experienced Guild adventurers to escort them through the desert

07ccc130b30062da.voiceContent: Hmm... Hey, do you know about the siltwater lakes in the desert

1618eef7b77e34b5.voiceContent: I heard that the Adventurers' Guild did once receive a commission related to siltwater lakes

1e4b1e39e18d1b03.voiceContent: With so many competitors in this line of work, laziness will only net you an empty stomach

245d67bbec2bbdda.voiceContent: I usually get woken up by random loud noises, so it was a surprise to wake up naturally this morning. To be honest, it's quite an unfamiliar experience

25a67f5a604ffad1.voiceContent: Legend has it that when his followers got lost in the desert, Al-Ahmar would command the underground rivers to rise to the surface, forming lakes for the trapped to quench their thirst..

2678d3a5c7f30017.voiceContent: Time for you to turn in already? Off you go, then. I'll be looking around some more

278498cab0aac191.voiceContent: You also can't forget to keep your guard up in case of troublemakers..

34763f1c9ee97eed.voiceContent: After that... Well, some say the Adventurers' Guild has never accepted similar commissions ever since

509ebc00fad752b2.voiceContent: You mean here? Uh, I can't think of anything in particular..

55bafc029183d874.voiceContent: Hmm... Why don't you show me around and introduce me to the others here

61d0df38e16474dd.voiceContent: Gladly, beats standing here twiddling my thumbs

71de7a2aab0a1389.voiceContent: That's life for ya. Everyone's stressed out one way or another, and there's no escaping it

742c566727071153.voiceContent: What? I can't hunt any of the animals here? Okay, fine. Then I'm gonna head out and find some fresh meat

78bc4278d46c384d.voiceContent: Did you really shove an entire kebab shop in here? It's got everything tools, equipment, even a table and chairs

793a134b29cd5237.voiceContent: The water in siltwater lakes does originate from groundwater, but it's too bitter to be used for drinking

7b192cbb7a29ccf7.voiceContent: Relax, you've got me. Just bring me along the next time you go to the desert, and I'll handle everything for ya

7cfb9fb720974546.voiceContent: Mercs camping in the wild rely on banners and weapon racks to protect themselves

7e6185c41a8fcfdd.voiceContent: You look like you're raring to go. Not surprising, given how comfy this place is. I slept like a log last night

82649a07f10af995.voiceContent: If I had to pick something, I guess I'd like to explore this place thoroughly

8357ae199b5df90f.voiceContent: Maintain my weapons, check my next job, sneak in a quick nap

880ad30d68688973.voiceContent: As for what the commission was about... I guess some outlanders who were visiting Sumeru wanted to visit the desert and see these lakes for themselves

8b8848888d9e3882.voiceContent: #Oh? Look who finally showed up. Any chance you've got an exciting gig for me, {NICKNAME}

9424b4fffaaf0b24.voiceContent: Besides, these lakes only exist for a short time before they're buried by sand, so you can't use them as landmarks

9794b3c96bb58668.voiceContent: However, if a not-so-reasonable person insists on approaching, that's when the weapon racks come in handy

a3e92562a3afdd50.voiceContent: Siltwater lakes usually appear farther inside the desert. According to some very tall tales, they're believed to be Al-Ahmar's blessings

a5c73ed2f40aa410.voiceContent: Whoa, what's with that look on your face? Scared stiff

a5e565bfb5d4e0b0.voiceContent: I know you said it's perfectly safe here, but to go to bed without someone on lookout... I don't think I'm used to that yet

af0335f915c47ec5.voiceContent: Especially that little bird named Tubby. Looks like she has her own teapot, what's up with that

b3dd8c99f85b1de3.voiceContent: Plus, you don't have to keep an eye out for monsters popping out of the ground or vultures swooping down from the sky

c40fe031b2f990c8.voiceContent: Even more so for mercs — we're looking for our next job before we even finish our current one

c56fec435da9543a.voiceContent: Hahaha, okay, enough serious talk. Days off are few and far between, so it'd be a waste not to unwind while I still can

e5f96690bc5f1ca5.voiceContent: I'll admit it's cozy here, but there's not a whole lot to do... I'm already getting bored..

ed3fcdbfece38aa9.voiceContent: Normally, any reasonable merc will know to keep their distance when they see another group's banner

f2a5246f6a94c74a.voiceContent: Since you've got everything ready... I say, let grill master Dehya take it from here

f4cbdeb210247acc.voiceContent: Haha, beats living in the desert. No crazy temperatures, no howling gales, no sandstorms..

f77cb1536d2d272e.voiceContent: But it's just an urban legend

fd0b6010315a5a04.voiceContent: I mean, this is my first time inside a teapot. I doubt anyone would believe me if I told them

001a224a8fbc1c02.voiceContent: We built the frame of the tower while you were gone

0194dc19018cdb88.voiceContent: By the way, Candace, your playing was amazing out there! How come you've never showed us before

21f2e4b41ff8ef06.voiceContent: Oh, well... It was just something that occurred to me while talking with Dunyarzad. The Sabzeruz Festival always seems to follow the same formula, so I figured a change of pace might be nice

2682f4f78815351c.voiceContent: Yeah, I'm trying make one for Candace, but I'm not happy with the result so far. I was just about to start from scratch

27e377768e969f70.voiceContent: #I'm sure you know more about this than me, {NICKNAME}. Can you give me some tips

2b12e109357a5c3e.voiceContent: She didn't agree to come with me to Liyue at first. Said she had to stay behind to protect the village

32a8c8e4e18d1c88.voiceContent: I ended up getting her a necklace, but then I heard about the whole gift envelope tradition during Lantern Rite, so I decided to try making one

3924f8c668325428.voiceContent: We're also planning a birthday meal after the Carriage Parade! So, we'll have a Haft-Mewa Feast as well

482684b9c428937f.voiceContent: Yeah? You've been someone's lapdog for so long that you don't know anything else now

5962144113fc48cb.voiceContent: Make sure you knock it out of the park

5a8b4052be7d0025.voiceContent: You're finally back! I was so worried! I was THIS close to sending some mercs after you

703434d50d530de6.voiceContent: #I'm sure you know more about this than me, {NICKNAME}. Can you give me some tips

7130729d0dd6a8ab.voiceContent: But, the caravan waits for no one... So, I'm here on my own for now

758678a4e9764764.voiceContent: You know what I mean, Candace. It's just a figure of speech

80be02ffb6a86ec7.voiceContent: I told her everyone deserves to let loose at the end of the year. I had to escort a caravan to Liyue, anyway, so she might as well come along

854def11640d95e1.voiceContent: But, I couldn't convince her. In the end, she only changed her mind because the people in the village pestered her to take time off

88ddf6d1dbc2e478.voiceContent: These Fatui have really crossed the line! Time to teach them a lesson

923712bcec453569.voiceContent: Hey, Candace, weren't you looking for someone to help you with the shopping

93336bdc1a52bd9c.voiceContent: Ah, that reminds me, I wonder if she's here yet... It's been a while..

936036ce96c5df63.voiceContent: Alright, it's settled! Tighnari will book the venue, Dunyarzad and I will take care of decorations, and you three are on food

95670eeea9b1a9ad.voiceContent: Not yet, but she'll be here

97c357edc7b7e4be.voiceContent: I guess this is like your gift to me! I don't have anything on me right now, but once I'm back in Sumeru, I'll be sure to send you something in return

9f9c867c834ebf98.voiceContent: Wait, aren't you also in the Parade this time, Candace? You're... playing the tanbur, right

a3b046abdc991aef.voiceContent: Dunyarzad liked the idea, and so did the others. So, we got the ball rolling pretty quickly

af647611f99f1249.voiceContent: Hey, we all deserve to loosen up once in a while! That's what festivals are for

c69100a4187a5062.voiceContent: Even then, she still insisted on wrapping up some work first

cb887819237199f3.voiceContent: There's so much vegetation here. It's different than what I expected

d77e95186bfbcc60.voiceContent: I even offered for some of my guys to look after the village in the meantime

e07862ddd99f5349.voiceContent: It was so hard to pick out a gift — there are just too many nice things to choose from around here

e5c784d59ee2c21a.voiceContent: Hey, seems like you're really learning your manners, Paimon

e8faa2df732f0133.voiceContent: #Fancy seeing you in these parts, {NICKNAME}. You must be here for Lantern Rite, too

ed6e79e448e5f747.voiceContent: Now, I just need to make one for Candace so I can give it to her with the necklace. I'm sure she'll love it

f1f196ccc9f338cf.voiceContent: And, well... Like I said, it hasn't been going great

f1fe65f5f64b1e61.voiceContent: Ooh? Looks like you've got a real knack for crafts. This gift envelope is beautiful, thank you

f2eac68af8e049db.voiceContent: Don't worry about that! Mercenaries can keep a secret like our lives depend on it

00506bab24666d9e.voiceContent: Now that the whole saga with the Akademiya's over, I guess she can finally dance as much as she wants. She offered me some of her face powder last time I saw her, but I didn't have the time to go fetch it. So I told her to give it to Candace instead. Hmm... I wonder how she's liking it? I need to go check sometime..

039d2d5bbeee71a2.voiceContent: Mmm, not bad... compared to rations, anyway

03f6bd991941359d.voiceContent: I won't go easy on you

0e7c757426504e80.voiceContent: Wind's picking up... Let's play it safe and pitch camp downwind of our target

0ebab77ac27f25c2.voiceContent: You know Ajilenakh Nuts, right? I used to go crazy for them as a kid... but my dad was the worst at shelling them. He'd just hack 'em to pieces with his knife, leaving a bunch of inedible mush behind. In the end, he'd salvage what he could by scraping pieces of the flesh off the shell, then mixing it with some milk and calling it porridge....I do miss the taste of that porridge sometimes... and I miss that old nut-cracker, too

17791778d9bf7f05.voiceContent: Ah, the famous merchant. I've heard that her prices aren't cheap, but is it true that she can get a hold of anything you want? Hahaha, then I should start talking to her, 'cause uh... some of the supplies we mercs need are impossible to get anywhere else on the market, no matter what you're willing to pay

18d01d29340d43e7.voiceContent: I'll use this to my advantage

1b5ff1ab61aa13f7.voiceContent: You sure don't miss an opportunity, do you

1d3f8d1395d20177.voiceContent: ...Kusayla was his name. As a merc, he had a slapdash way of working and a whole lot of bravado. But he also saved me from the desert, and did whatever he could to pass on to me everything he had.Without him, I wouldn't be who I am today

1e8ed71f8003e20e.voiceContent: I never once imagined I could get to this level... All credit goes to you. What next? Do you have a job for me? Whatever it is, just say the word and I'll be there

20b05efc2e190d6f.voiceContent: Urgh... We've got ourselves a tough cookie

21eb797fc5493172.voiceContent: According to some of the older Eremites, it does actually rain in the desert on occasion. And when it does, it's always a lot heavier than this

295db6ff8310261d.voiceContent: The Eremites is just a title — any mercenary in Sumeru can call themselves a member. Sadly, you get some mercs throwing the term around to take advantage of outlanders who don't know any better... Hmph. We've got those jerks to thank for the increasingly abysmal reputation we have these days

2a8402a5207c950c.voiceContent: Most mercs are looking to make their fortune and leave their mark. They take on the hardest jobs they can find, hoping to earn as much Mora and prestige as possible. Some are lucky enough to survive and become legends, while others disappear into the desert before anyone's learned their name.I don't have any grand aspirations though. I just want to keep the people I care about safe, so they can live their lives in peace. Of course, I won't complain if I can make some extra Mora along the way, haha

2f13eeb6cde1bc2e.voiceContent: Being a merc is tough. The work itself is one thing, but the worst part is trying to get your client to pay you after you finish the job. The Akademiya's top of my list — they're pretty straightforward. The Adventurers' Guild isn't too bad either. But trading merchants can be a total nightmare. They're always telling me that their funds are tied up, so cash is tight, yadda yadda. Just a few more days, they say.If cash is so tight, how'd you pay for that big pile of goods on your cart, hmm? Tsk

31082b50bb3ec188.voiceContent: A lot of people see the Red Vulture as an omen of death and disaster, because it feeds on the carcasses of the dead. But the way it soars high above the desert... I've always seen it as a symbol of the tenacity of life.I wonder what the Great Red Sand looks like from all the way up there

311de74de03ea2e1.voiceContent: How's my life changed since getting my Vision? Huh... Well, obviously it gives me an extra edge in battle, but honestly, the biggest thing for me is that it's helped me bring a few more mercs into the Blazing Beasts..

32317ad56ffba9c8.voiceContent: This tastes amazing! I'd better not have any more, or I'll never be able to go back to my usual rations

35ee1dfedd3562f4.voiceContent: Ah, sun's out, guns out, hehe... Just sucks that I got so much work to do

36e4dd5be4c6df6a.voiceContent: You're still working at this hour? Ugh, and I thought we mercs had it tough

46799a52177269a0.voiceContent: Ready to roll? Good. Then let's pack up and move out

46ce6b8b7a4a6585.voiceContent: Hahaha, the one that got away... I came thiiis close to doing a job for that guy. A contact put us in touch — I was supposed to be his guide through the desert for some kind of investigation. But then it got canceled out of the blue, no idea why. Wait, actually... I think there was something about him not being good with the heat? I'm not sure, but it could have been that..

569360700107e7ae.voiceContent: My name's Dehya. I'm the merc you hired. So what you got for me? A commission? A fight? Armed escort? Whatever it is — you know where to find me

5901c90bf457b049.voiceContent: Get out before I drag you out

5f610aa147e990bc.voiceContent: Ahh, the sleepy girl, yeah, I think I remember her. I ran into her once at an oasis on the outskirts of the desert. She was out with some group from the Akademiya doing astronomical observations, or something. I wasn't really paying attention. ...Huh? Candace... what now? Emissary from the stars? The heck is that all about? Almost sounds like she didn't wake up before getting out of bed

64fc3e49793eeb5b.voiceContent: Oh yeah, I only found out about him being from the Temple of Silence recently, too. Ahh, sorry, no — I'm no expert in mysterious organizations like that. Seen him a few times in the desert though. He's very down-to-earth. Once when my guys got into some trouble in the desert, he was kind enough to share his drinking water with them. Nice guy

72236b104982ed6c.voiceContent: Hey, this feels good. I think I'll be able to hit quite a bit harder with my sword now

7b437c14e4170240.voiceContent: You know, if nothing else, it's uh... filling, and if it fills you up — it's good grub! Hahaha..

8177325746cb8a3a.voiceContent: He offered me a position in the Akademiya once. I declined — working in a place like that would bore me to death. He, on the other hand, is exactly the kind of person I can imagine working there... always talking in long, convoluted sentences, and in that snooty tone... Tsk

819ffa777537de5c.voiceContent: Where did the morning go... Alright, soon as I see a good spot, I'll set up the stove and cook us some lunch

827466aa12980206.voiceContent: Stay close, no going off on your own. The desert doesn't take prisoners

8299621b81b37c73.voiceContent: Your recent feats have been doing the rounds, you know. In my brigade alone, a lot of people have been talking about the things you've achieved. I've even had several people ask me if I can introduce them to you

92eebcb52fc65eab.voiceContent: Happy Birthday! Reach into your pocket, your present's already in there. How'd I do it? Hehe, just a little trick of the trade. Anyway, more importantly, I've booked us a real feast at Lambad's Tavern, so let's get ourselves over there! ...Huh? Oh, don't worry, I didn't invite any of the other mercs. Nah, that rowdy bunch is always getting into arguments — not the kind of people you'd want at a birthday celebration. It'll just be me and you, like it should be... Ahem, c'mon, c'mon, let's go

963c8fb3a226bfee.voiceContent: Impressive, seems you've got some skill

99681c9c421909dd.voiceContent: The Akademiya have taken a kinder view of us since everything that went down. I heard that they even released a ton of new regulations to support the desert folk. Hmph, it'd take me till the end of time to read and understand all that documentation... I just hope from now on, the Wall of Samiel will only mark the place where sandstorms end, rather than my folks' hopes and dreams

9f5bfe9c1be586f4.voiceContent: Ah, Candace... I love her to bits, but she can be as stubborn as a Sumpter Beast sometimes. I keep telling her she oughtta cut herself some slack, take some time off, maybe go take a walk around Sumeru City, buy herself some nice new clothes or jewelry... but she always says the same old thing She can't bear to leave the village unprotected. I dunno how many times she's turned me down now. Ugh, if I really can't persuade her, I guess I'll just have to watch the village for her sometime, and get one of my Eremite girls to take her shopping..

a1e20c5c40ad86a9.voiceContent: Some clients are behind on their payments again, and a few of the guys got themselves into trouble during their last job... *sigh* I'm not the boss, but somehow everything ends up being my problem..

a2862914cbb97cbf.voiceContent: The desert's a tough adversary, but at least it doesn't hide anything. What you see is what you get, and whether you take on the challenge is entirely up to you

a30ccc50863bc88a.voiceContent: Friends? Hmm... I dunno, after everything we've been through, all the battles we've faced together? Somehow, friends just doesn't quite do it justice.I think... yeah, comrades-in-arms sums it up best for me. The bond we share can only be forged in the heat of battle. It's one of the most unbreakable bonds there is

a6d03325cf1d8574.voiceContent: I could make a tidy sum selling some of this..

ad899e9e62a32914.voiceContent: I looove my make-up box. Sometimes I take it out and re-organize it when I have the time. I keep all my powders and brushes in here — paid top Mora for all of it. Just look at this texture! Isn't it just perfectly smooth? And even if you sweat or get caught in the rain, it doesn't run. Hehehe, you get what you pay for

aef56a35d3f0d29d.voiceContent: Candied Ajilenakh Nuts, no contest. Easy to take on the road, and of course delicious

b0d150ae8a81e737.voiceContent: Where do I feel like I belong? No idea. I've never thought about that sort of thing before. If I had to pick... I've lived most of my life in the desert, so I guess that makes me a desert-dweller

b2f8a5ae32c4e066.voiceContent: This tastes amazing! I'd better not have any more, or I'll never be able to go back to my usual rations

b52ab08bd4164eae.voiceContent: You know, if nothing else, it's uh... filling, and if it fills you up — it's good grub! Hahaha..

b882e8d375fc5929.voiceContent: Time to get down to business

bb6c06e234401b69.voiceContent: Man, this thunder is loud. They won't hear us coming... or vice versa

bd5877aefe3ce330.voiceContent: Hmph... You know, I always thought the Akademiya's worst were just a bunch of greedy dogs, each fighting for their slice of the pie... Nope. Turns out they were a vicious pack of wolves who betrayed the whole nation. If you want my opinion... Lesser Lord Kusanali was too good to them. Those animals didn't deserve her mercy — she should've broken every single bone in their bodies! Instead, they got a nice little vacation in the rainforest... To say they got off lightly is just putting it mildly

ce8ad6ecaa296555.voiceContent: *grimace* ...Are you kidding me? This is even colder than the nights in the desert..

db8062c604647250.voiceContent: I've lived around Eremites my whole life. As a little girl, I had a wooden sword for a toy. Everyone I knew growing up was either a merc or on their way to becoming one, and even the bowls we ate our meals from were carved by mercenary blades... After an upbringing like that, it'd be more surprising if I didn't become a merc when I grew up, right

dc7798f5bdba3a03.voiceContent: Huh? How about that... I really did get stronger

dda18507683c383d.voiceContent: So much power... I have to go test this out. You down to spar with me or what

dfd79b2ce070a4b8.voiceContent: We mercs have one simple rule Whoever pays the most is your new boss

ef83d45352fadb56.voiceContent: The General Mahamatra? Doesn't suffer fools gladly, and certainly doesn't beat around the bush. Having seen the way he works, he gets a thumbs up from me

f4b6c71bd3a7a5d6.voiceContent: My people are used to the desert life... But still, I hope that one day, they'll be able to find an oasis of their own, and leave the sandstorms behind for a better life

f721c2cb944baf7a.voiceContent: It's late. Go get some rest, I'll take the night watch

fb44e5824253b9ec.voiceContent: Mmm, not bad... compared to rations, anyway

fe7c28f31c2fff69.voiceContent: Anything bitter. Nope. Keep it away from me. Can't stand it
